definition: to hold back/to restrain/to control (oneself)/to collect/Taiwan pr. [lian4]

sentences.english: He’s quiet and reflective, and he dresses conservatively.
sentences.chinese: 他为人安静内敛，穿着保守。

sentences.english: Grieved emotion is the heavy experience, it is difficult to disappear.
sentences.chinese: 哀怨情感内敛凝聚，是沉重的体验，易郁结不散。

sentences.english: Hold back hospitably and inside, but individual character is harmonious.
sentences.chinese: 热情且内敛，个性而和谐。

sentences.english: " Look at the quiet reserved Zhou Bichang Break how "happy camp "?
sentences.chinese: 看文静内敛的周笔畅如何玩转《快乐大本营》？

sentences.english: Representing the self-containedness, self-restraint and the essence of well-balanced tension and relaxation of the oriental culture.
sentences.chinese: 是体现东方文化的内敛，涵养，处世的张弛有度。

sentences.english: Some may find it too grim and too internalized.
sentences.chinese: 也有人可能觉得这实在过于冷酷和内敛了。

sentences.english: Our culture is introverted, " Gong says.
sentences.chinese: 我们的文化原本就很讲究内敛，”龚说道。
中国人是内敛的，含蓄的。

sentences.english: The pure white table gives you a sense of quiet and conservative manner.
sentences.chinese: 纯白的台面，让一切呈现简静内敛的气质。

definition: to contain/to hold/(of a person or style etc) reserved/restrained/(of words, writings) full of hidden meaning/implicit/veiled (criticism)
cultured and refined (idiom); gentle and cultivated
deep/profound/(of a person) reserved/undemonstrative/(of a voice, sound etc) deep/low-pitched
